question: Biology is the science of life forms and living ____.
The living world comprises amazing ____ of organisms.

Early man perceived difference between living and ____ matter.
Early man could easily ____ differences between living and non-living.
Early man deified inanimate matter like ____.
Along with fire and sea, early man also deified ____.
Common feature of inanimate and animate forms was ____.
The sense evoked by animate and inanimate forms was ____.
Description of living beings began much later in ____ history.
Description of organisms including ____ began late in history.
The limited progress was due to ____ view of biology.
Anthropocentric views caused limited ____ in biology.
Identification, classification and ____ developed out of necessity.
Detailed systems of nomenclature and classification followed ____ description.
Such studies led to recognition of ____ among organisms.
Similarities were observed both horizontally and ____.
Relatedness among organisms led to ____ of biodiversity.
Realisation of universal relatedness humbled ____.
The perspective used for classification is ____'s.
Classification is of ____ and plants.
